intro: Aphanactis, commonly known as the common aphanactis, is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its small, inconspicuous flowers that often grow in clusters. The plants typically have narrow, linear leaves and are often found in dry, open habitats. Aphanactis species are generally herbaceous and may have a creeping or upright growth habit. They are adapted to arid environments and play a role in stabilizing soil in their native ranges.
